title: Retry build/deploy by fixing the current deployment error

requirements.text: Identify and fix the cause of the current build/deployment failure, then ensure the app can be built and deployed successfully without breaking existing functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build succeeds for both frontend and backend (no TypeScript/Vite build errors; no Motoko compile errors).
A deploy succeeds (no deployment-time traps or canister install errors).

After deploy, the app loads and the existing notebook workflow still works end-to-end: user can log in with Internet Identity, select a date, load the saved follower list for that date, edit names, and save successfully.
No user-facing text introduced by the fix is non-English (all new/changed UI strings are in English).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if an actual stable-state upgrade is required.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not introduce unsupported technologies (no external databases/services, no alternative auth providers, no WebSockets).
nonGoals: Do not add new product features beyond what is necessary to resolve the deployment failure and complete a successful deploy.
Do not redesign the UI/visual theme unless required to fix the build/deploy error.
